title: Lily Allen becomes Instagram official with Stranger Things actor David Harbour
text:

Lily Allen has made things Insta-official with her new boyfriend, Stranger Things actor David Harbour.

The couple were spotted piling on the PDA during a stroll in New York City recently, as they walked hand in hand through Manhatten.

And now smitten Lily, 33, has posted a photo of David, 44, on her Instagram account.

In the photo, David was hosting his Saturday Night Live gig, and Lily honed in on his bulging biceps with the caption: "Mine."

She also posted a series of selfies where she announced she was leaving the UK until after Brexit on October 31st.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

She was supporting her new beau as he hosted the show for the first time, and she was seen leaving with his family.

The pair have been spotted on dates together a number of times, including at the Hughie Fury and Alexander Povetkin boxing match in London.

They were also seen leaving a London theatre together earlier this year.

Lily has two daughters from her marriage to Sam Cooper, and she split from her boyfriend of three years, grime MC Medirian Dan, last year.

She recently claimed to have had a fling with Oasis rocker Liam Gallagher.

(Image: BrosNYC / BACKGRID)

David reportedly split from actress Alison Sudol earlier this year.

The actor recently opened up about his battle with bipolar disorder.

He said that it is linked to the times in his life when his "creative energies" have taken a dip.

He said: "First of all the interesting thing about my own particular brand of it is that I never have an episode when I working.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

"So, in some way I’ve generally been able to see a link between my own creative energies when they are channelled into some kind of work form and that when they are not channelled that it goes off into some kind of madness."

Due to him having issues when not working, David admitted that it is imperative that he is kept busy.

David continued: "In that way, it has made working even more vital to me, it’s kind of a lifeline.

"There are these things in society, that we very much tout, like medications and things like that, and I think they are all good.

"But there are also these intangibles, things that actually keep us alive, to me talk therapy is really important and acting."

David concluded that if it wasn't for acting, then his life may have taken a much darker turn.

He continued: "It’s important for me to be an artist, and I think if I wasn’t an artist I’d be a lot worse off and has made work more vital."
description: The singer and the actor have surprised us with their unlikely romance, but they seem to be moving from strength to strength
